}} 'The Chapters' are a six-nine piece band from Dublin, Ireland. The band are
composed of Ross McNally, Michael Murphy, Ciaran Fortune, NC Lawlor, Aoife Ruth
and Biggles flys again. Addition string, brass and guest players join the band
on occasion.

The Chapters have featured on a number of radio and television stations in
Ireland, including Dublin's 98, Today FM RTÃ 2fm and Phantom FM since the release of their album and have performed
at several festivals such as Castlepalooza, Indie-pendence and Oxegen. They also
performed at the Arthur's Day celebrations. In 2008, they supported more
established musicians such as Chuck Berry, Cathy Davey and Neil Young. Their music has also
been used by RTÃ as well as by UK broadcaster ITV in its soap opera
[[Emmerdale]].
